message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.HC

The paper describes a deep learning approach to predicting natural human arm movements using both electrocorticography (ECoG) and video modalities. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Among these, machine learning and computer vision are the most likely categories, as they are directly related to the deep learning approach used in the paper. Neural and evolutionary computing is also likely, as it pertains to the use of neural recordings in the study. Artificial intelligence and human-computer interaction are less likely, but still possible, as they relate to the broader implications of the research for bioelectronic technologies and human neuroscience.
